class lyrebird.cli.LyrebirdClient(provider: Provider, model: str | None = None, verbose: bool = False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Client for interacting with Large Language Model (LLM) APIs.

This class provides a unified interface to interact with different LLM providers including OpenRouter, DeepSeek, and Ollama. It handles authentication, model selection, and request formatting.

providerÔÉÅ

The LLM service provider to use

Type:

Provider

verboseÔÉÅ

Flag to enable verbose logging

Type:

bool

modelÔÉÅ

The specific model to use for requests

Type:

str

clientÔÉÅ

The client instance for the selected provider

Type:

Union[OpenAI, ollama]

Example

>>> client = LyrebirdClient(Provider.ollama, model="codellama", verbose=True)
>>> response = client.make_request("System prompt", "User query")

lyrebird.cli.chat(provider: ~lyrebird.cli.Provider = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, model: str | None = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Start a coding-focused chat session with the assistant.

This command initiates an interactive chat session where users can ask coding-related questions and receive responses from the LLM. The session continues until the user types ‚Äòexit‚Äô or ‚Äòquit‚Äô.

Parameters:

  • provider (Provider) ‚Äì The LLM service provider to use for the chat session.

  • model (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The specific model name to use for chat responses. If not provided, a default model for the selected provider will be used.

lyrebird.cli.explain(file: ~pathlib.Path | None = <typer.models.ArgumentInfo object>, provider: ~lyrebird.cli.Provider = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, model: str | None = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, output_format: ~lyrebird.cli.OutputFormat = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, verbose: bool = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Explain code functionality and structure.

This command takes code from a file or stdin and provides a detailed explanation of its purpose, functionality, structure, algorithms, and design patterns. It aims to help users understand complex codebases.

Parameters:

  • file (Optional[Path]) ‚Äì The path to the file containing the code to explain. If None, code will be read from stdin.

  • provider (Provider) ‚Äì The LLM service provider to use for explanation.

  • model (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The specific model name to use. If not provided, a default model for the selected provider will be used.

  • output_format (OutputFormat) ‚Äì The desired format for the output.

  • verbose (bool) ‚Äì If True, enables verbose logging.

Raises:

typer.Exit(1) ‚Äì If no code is provided, or if the explanation fails.

lyrebird.cli.fix(file: ~pathlib.Path | None = <typer.models.ArgumentInfo object>, provider: ~lyrebird.cli.Provider = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, model: str | None = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, output_format: ~lyrebird.cli.OutputFormat = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, verbose: bool = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Fix bugs and errors in code.

This command takes code from a file or stdin, identifies bugs, syntax errors, and logical issues, and then provides a corrected version of the code. It attempts to detect the programming language based on the file extension.

Parameters:

  • file (Optional[Path]) ‚Äì The path to the file containing the code to fix. If None, code will be read from stdin.

  • provider (Provider) ‚Äì The LLM service provider to use for code fixing.

  • model (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The specific model name to use. If not provided, a default model for the selected provider will be used.

  • output_format (OutputFormat) ‚Äì The desired format for the output (e.g., ‚Äútext‚Äù for direct code display, ‚Äújson‚Äù for structured output).

  • verbose (bool) ‚Äì If True, enables verbose logging.

Raises:

typer.Exit(1) ‚Äì If no code is provided, or if code fixing fails.

lyrebird.cli.format_output(content: str, output_format: OutputFormat, task: str) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Format output according to the specified format.

If output_format is OutputFormat.json, the content is wrapped in a JSON object along with task, timestamp, and version information. Otherwise, the raw content is returned.

Parameters:

  • content (str) ‚Äì The primary content to be formatted.

  • output_format (OutputFormat) ‚Äì The desired output format (e.g., text, json).

  • task (str) ‚Äì A description of the task being performed (used in JSON output).

Returns:

The formatted output string.

Return type:

str

lyrebird.cli.generate(prompt: str = <typer.models.ArgumentInfo object>, provider: ~lyrebird.cli.Provider = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, file: ~pathlib.Path | None = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, language: str = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, model: str | None = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, output_format: ~lyrebird.cli.OutputFormat = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, verbose: bool = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate code from a natural language prompt.

This command takes a natural language prompt and optional context from a file to generate code in a specified programming language. It interacts with an LLM provider (OpenRouter, DeepSeek, or Ollama) to produce the code.

Parameters:

  • prompt (str) ‚Äì A detailed description of the coding task.

  • provider (Provider) ‚Äì The LLM service provider to use.

  • file (Optional[Path]) ‚Äì An optional input file whose content will be used as additional context for code generation.

  • language (str) ‚Äì The programming language for the generated code (default: ‚Äúpython‚Äù).

  • model (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The specific model name to use for code generation. If not provided, a default model for the selected provider will be used.

  • output_format (OutputFormat) ‚Äì The desired format for the output (e.g., ‚Äútext‚Äù for direct code display, ‚Äújson‚Äù for structured output).

  • verbose (bool) ‚Äì If True, enables verbose logging to display debug information.

Raises:

typer.Exit(1) ‚Äì If code generation fails due to API errors or other issues.

lyrebird.cli.refactor(file: ~pathlib.Path | None = <typer.models.ArgumentInfo object>, provider: ~lyrebird.cli.Provider = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, model: str | None = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, output_format: ~lyrebird.cli.OutputFormat = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, verbose: bool = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Refactor code for better performance and readability.

This command takes code from a file or stdin and uses an LLM to refactor it. The refactoring aims to improve readability, performance, maintainability, and adherence to best practices, all while preserving original functionality.

Parameters:

  • file (Optional[Path]) ‚Äì The path to the file containing the code to refactor. If None, code will be read from stdin.

  • provider (Provider) ‚Äì The LLM service provider to use for refactoring.

  • model (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The specific model name to use. If not provided, a default model for the selected provider will be used.

  • output_format (OutputFormat) ‚Äì The desired format for the output.

  • verbose (bool) ‚Äì If True, enables verbose logging.

Raises:

typer.Exit(1) ‚Äì If no code is provided, or if refactoring fails.

lyrebird.cli.summarize(directory: ~pathlib.Path = <typer.models.ArgumentInfo object>, provider: ~lyrebird.cli.Provider = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, model: str | None = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, output_format: ~lyrebird.cli.OutputFormat = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, verbose: bool = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Summarize codebase structure and architecture.

This command analyzes a given directory, identifies common code files, and provides a high-level summary of the codebase‚Äôs architecture, main components, technology stack, design patterns, and overall functionality. It helps in quickly grasping the essence of a project.

Parameters:

  • directory (Path) ‚Äì The path to the directory containing the codebase to summarize. The directory must exist.

  • provider (Provider) ‚Äì The LLM service provider to use for summarization.

  • model (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The specific model name to use. If not provided, a default model for the selected provider will be used.

  • output_format (OutputFormat) ‚Äì The desired format for the output.

  • verbose (bool) ‚Äì If True, enables verbose logging.

Raises:

typer.Exit(1) ‚Äì If the provided path is not a valid directory, if no code files are found, or if the summarization fails.

lyrebird.cli.test(file: ~pathlib.Path = <typer.models.ArgumentInfo object>, provider: ~lyrebird.cli.Provider = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, model: str | None = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate or enhance unit tests for a Python file.

Given the source code of a Python file, this command leverages an LLM to produce new or improved unit tests to validate its functionality. The output is primarily the generated test code, preferably using pytest.

Parameters:

  • file (Path) ‚Äì The path to the Python file for which to generate/improve tests. The file must exist.

  • provider (Provider) ‚Äì The LLM service provider to use for test generation.

  • model (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The specific model name to use. If not provided, a default model for the selected provider will be used.

Module contentsÔÉÅ

Lyrebird CLI: An AI-Powered Coding Assistant in Your Terminal

A modern CLI tool that brings LLM-powered code generation, debugging, refactoring, and explanation capabilities directly to your terminal.

Supports OpenRouter and DeepSeek APIs for flexible model selection.
